verses.text: The earthen vessel that he who has the discharge touches shall be broken, and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he who has a discharge is cleansed of his issue, then he shall count to himself seven days for his cleansing, and wash his clothes, and bathe his body in running water, and shall be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day he shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons and come before the Lord at the entrance of the tent of meeting and give them to the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall offer them, one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering, and the priest shall make atonement for him before the Lord for his discharge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man has a seminal emission, then he shall wash all his body in water and be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every garment and all leather on which there is seminal emission shall be washed with water and be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with a woman, and there is an emission of semen, they shall both bathe themselves in water and be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a woman has a discharge, and the discharge from her body is blood, she shall be set apart for seven days; and whoever touches her shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything that she lies on in her menstrual impurity shall be unclean. Also, everything that she sits on shall be unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever touches her bed shall wash his clothes and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever touches anything on which she sits shall wash his clothes and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether it is the bed or anything on which she sits, when he touches it he shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man lies with her, and her menstrual impurity is on him, he shall be unclean seven days, and every bed where he lies shall be unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a woman has a discharge of blood for many days, not at the time of her menstrual impurity, or if she has a discharge beyond the time of her impurity, all the days of the discharge she shall be in uncleanness, as in the days of her impurity. She shall be unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every bed that she lies on all the days of her discharge shall be for impurity, and whatever she sits on shall be unclean, as the uncleanness of her menstrual impurity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever touches those things shall be unclean and shall wash his clothes and bathe himself in water and be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if she is cleansed of her discharge, then she shall count to herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day she shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons and bring them to the priest at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall offer one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering, and the priest shall make atonement for her before the Lord for her unclean discharge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you shall separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness, so that they do not die in their uncleanness by defiling My tabernacle that is among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law for him who has a discharge and for him who has a seminal emission and thus becomes unclean,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for her who is sick from her menstruation, and for him who has a discharge, for anyone male or female, and for the man who lies with a woman who is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they drew near to the Lord and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses: Speak to Aaron your brother so that he does not come at any time into the Holy Place within the veil before the mercy seat, which is on the ark, so that he will not die, for I will appear in the cloud on the mercy seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Aaron shall come into the Holy Place with a young bull for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall put on the holy linen tunic, and he shall have the linen undergarment on his body, and shall be girded with a linen sash, and shall be wearing the linen turban. These are holy garments. Therefore he shall wash his body in water and then put them on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall take from the congregation of the children of Israel two male goats for a sin offering and one ram for a burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall offer his bull for the sin offering, which is for himself, and make atonement for himself and for his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he shall take the two goats and present them before the Lord at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall cast lots for the two goats: one lot for the Lord and the other lot for the scapegoat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall bring the goat on which the lot of the Lord falls and offer him for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the goat on which the lot falls to be the scapegoat shall be presented alive before the Lord to make atonement with it, that it may be sent away as a scapegoat into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall bring the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and shall make atonement for himself, and for his house, and shall kill the bull of the sin offering for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall take a censer full of burning coals of fire from the altar before the Lord, and two handfuls of sweet incense beaten small, and bring it within the veil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall put the incense on the fire before the Lord, that the cloud of the incense may cover the mercy seat that is over the testimony, so that he does not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall take of the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it with his finger on the mercy seat on the eastern side, and before the mercy seat he shall sprinkle from the blood with his finger seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he shall kill the goat of the sin offering, which is for the people, and bring its blood within the veil, and do with that blood as he did with the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it over and in front of the mercy seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall make atonement for the Holy Place, because of the uncleanness of the children of Israel and because of their transgressions in all their sins, and so he shall do for the tent of meeting that remains among them in the midst of their uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be no man in the tent of meeting when he goes in to make atonement in the Holy Place, until he comes out and has made atonement for himself, and for his household, and for all the congregation of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he shall go out to the altar that is before the Lord and make atonement for it, and he shall take some of the blood of the bull and some of the blood of the goat, and put it on the horns of the altar all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall sprinkle from the blood on it with his finger seven times, and cleanse it, and consecrate it from the uncleanness of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he has made an end of atonement for the Holy Place, and the tent of meeting, and the altar, then he shall bring the live goat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron shall lay both his hands on the head of the live goat, and confess over it all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions in all their sins, putting them on the head of the goat, and shall send it away by the hand of a designated man into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the goat shall bear on it all their iniquities to a desolate land, and he shall let the goat go free in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron shall come into the tent of meeting, and shall take off the linen garments which he put on when he went into the Holy Place, and shall leave them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall wash his body with water in a holy place, and put on his garments, and come out, and offer his burnt offering, and the burnt offering of the people, and make atonement for himself and for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fat of the sin offering he shall burn on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who releases the goat as the scapegoat shall wash his clothes, and bathe his body in water, and afterward come into the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bull for the sin offering and the goat for the sin offering, whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the Holy Place, shall be carried outside the camp. They shall burn in the fire their hides, their flesh, and their refuse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who burns them shall wash his clothes, and bathe his body in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be a perpetual statute for you so that in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall humble yourselves, and do no work of any kind, whether it is the native citizen or the stranger who sojourns among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For on that day the priest shall make atonement for you to cleanse you, so that you may be clean from all your sins before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be a sabbath, a solemn rest for you, and you shall humble yourselves. It is a perpetual statute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest, who is anointed and consecrated to minister as a priest in the place of his father, shall make atonement, and shall put on the linen garments, the holy garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall make atonement for the Holy Sanctuary, for the tent of meeting, and for the altar, and he shall make atonement for the priests, and for all the people of the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This shall be a perpetual statute for you to make atonement for the children of Israel for all their sins once a year.
And Moses did as the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel, and say to them: This is the thing which the Lord has commanded, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone of the house of Israel ritually slaughters an ox, a lamb, or goat in the camp, or slaughters it outside of the camp,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and does not bring it to the entrance of the tent of meeting to offer it as a gift to the Lord before the tabernacle of the Lord, then blood guilt shall be accounted to that man. He has shed blood, and that man shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is so that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices which they offer in the open field, even that they may bring them to the Lord at the entrance of the tent of meeting, to the priest, and offer them for peace offerings to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall sprinkle the blood on the altar of the Lord at the entrance of the tent of meeting, and burn the fat for a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall no more offer their sacrifices to goat demons, after whom they have acted like whores. This shall be a perpetual statute for them throughout their generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall say to them: Any man from the house of Israel, or from the foreigners who sojourn among you, who offers a burnt offering or sacrifice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and does not bring it to the entrance of the tent of meeting to offer it to the Lord, even that man shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever from the house of Israel, or from the strangers who sojourn among you, who eats any manner of blood, I will set My face against that person who eats blood, and will cut him off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have given it to you on the altar to make atonement for your lives; for it is the blood that makes atonement for the soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I said to the children of Israel: No person among you shall eat blood, nor shall any stranger who sojourns among you eat blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever from the children of Israel, or from the foreigners who sojourn among you, who hunts and catches any wild animal or fowl that may be eaten, he shall even pour out the blood and cover it with dirt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the life of every creature is its blood; in its blood is its life. Therefore I said to the children of Israel: You shall not eat the blood of any creature, for the life of every creature is its blood. Whoever eats it shall be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every person who eats that which died of itself, or that which was torn by animals, whether he is a native citizen or a foreigner, he shall both wash his clothes and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening. Then he shall be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does not wash them or bathe his body, then he shall bear his iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the practices of the land of Egypt, from where you lived, you shall not follow, and after the practices of the land of Canaan, to where I will bring you, you shall not follow; nor shall you walk in their ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall follow My decrees and keep My ordinances to walk in them: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall therefore keep My statutes and My judgments, which if a man does them, then he shall live by them: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of you shall approach any of his near relatives to have relations: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not have relations with your father or have relations with your mother. She is your mother. You shall not have relations with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not have relations with your father’s wife, for this exposes your father’s nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not have relations with your sister, whether your father’s or mother’s daughter, whether raised in the family or another home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not have relations with your son’s daughter or your daughter’s daughter, for this exposes your own nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not have relations with your father’s wife’s daughter who is raised in your father’s family, for she is your sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not have relations with your father’s sister, for she is your father’s relative.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not have relations with your mother’s sister, for she is your mother’s relative.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not expose the nakedness of your father’s brother. You shall not approach his wife for relations; she is your aunt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not have relations with your daughter-in-law, for she is your son’s wife—you shall not have relations with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not have relations with your brother’s wife, for this exposes your brother’s nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not have relations with a woman and her daughter, nor shall you have her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter, for this exposes the woman’s nakedness. They are all near relatives. It is depravity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not have a woman as a rival wife, who is the sister of your other wife, for this is to expose her nakedness while her sister, your other wife, is still alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also you shall not approach a woman to have relations as long as she is in her menstrual uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, you shall not have relations with your neighbor’s wife to defile yourself with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not let any of your children be offered through the fire to Molek, and so profane the name of your God: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not lie with a man as one does with a woman. It is an abomination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not lie with an animal to defile yourself, nor shall any woman lie with an animal. It is a perversion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not defile yourselves in any of these ways, for in these practices the nations I am casting out before you have defiled themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the land has become defiled; therefore I have punished its iniquity, and the land has vomited out her inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall therefore keep My statutes and My decrees, and you shall not commit any of these abominations, either the native citizen or any foreigner who sojourns among you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for the people of the land, who were before you, committed all of these abominations, and the land became defiled),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lest the land vomit you out also when you defile it, as it vomited out the nations that were before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever shall commit any of these abominations, those persons who commit them shall be cut off from among their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you shall keep My ordinances, that you do not commit any one of these abominable customs which were committed before you, so that you do not defile yourselves by them: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to all the congregation of the children of Israel, and say to them: You shall be holy, for I the Lord your God am holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every one of you shall revere his mother and his father, and you will keep My Sabbaths: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not turn to idols, nor make for yourselves cast metal gods: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you offer a sacrifice of peace offerings to the Lord, you shall offer it so that you might be accepted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be eaten the same day you offer it or on the next day, and if any remains until the third day, it shall be burned in the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is eaten at all on the third day, then it is contaminated. It shall not be accepted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore everyone who eats it shall bear his iniquity, because he has defiled what is holy of the Lord, and that person shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap up to the edge of your field, nor shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not glean bare your vineyard, nor shall you gather every fallen grape of your vineyard. You shall leave them for the poor and stranger: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not steal, nor deal falsely, nor lie to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not swear falsely by My name, and so defile the name of your God: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not defraud your neighbor or rob him. The wages of him who is hired shall not stay with you all night until the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling block before the blind, but you shall fear your God: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do no unrighteousness in a court. You shall not be partial to the poor, nor honor the person who is great, but in righteousness you shall judge your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not go around as a slanderer among your people, nor shall you stand by while the life of your neighbor is in danger: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not hate your brother in your heart. You shall surely reason honestly with your neighbor, and not suffer sin because of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not take vengeance, nor bear any grudge against the children of your people, but you shall love your neighbor as yourself: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall keep My statutes.
You shall not let your livestock breed with a different kind.
You shall not sow your field with mixed seed, nor shall your garment be mixed from two types of fabric.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever lies with a slave woman who is betrothed to another man and not yet ransomed or given freedom, compensation will be made. They shall not be put to death, because she was not free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall bring his guilt offering to the Lord at the entrance of the tent of meeting, a ram for a guilt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the guilt offering before the Lord for his sin which he has done, and he will be forgiven for the sin that he has committed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you come into the land and plant any kind of tree for food, then you shall count the fruit as forbidden. Three years it shall be forbidden to you. It shall not be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the fourth year all the fruit shall be holy and an offering of praise to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the fifth year you shall eat of the fruit that it may yield an increase to you: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not eat anything with the blood in it, nor shall you practice divination or fortune-telling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not round the corners of the hair on your head, nor shall you mar the edges of your beard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead nor make any tattoo marks on yourselves: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not prostitute your daughter and cause her to be defiled, lest the land fall into whoredom and become full of wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep My Sabbaths and revere My sanctuary: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not turn to spirits through mediums or necromancers. Do not seek after them to be defiled by them: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall rise up before a gray head, and honor the face of an old man, and fear your God: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a foreigner sojourns with you in your land, you shall not do him wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foreigner who dwells with you shall be to you as one born among you, and you shall love him as yourself for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do no unrighteousness in judgment regarding measures in length, weight, or quantity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall have honest balances, honest weights, an honest ephah, and an honest hin: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you shall observe all My statutes and all My judgments and do them: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, you shall say to the children of Israel: Whoever from the children of Israel or from the foreigners who sojourn in Israel who gives any of his children to Molek, he shall surely be put to death. The people of the land shall stone him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set My face against that man and will cut him off from among his people, because he has given some of his descendants to Molek to defile My sanctuary and to defile My holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the people of the land in any way hide their eyes from the man when he gives of his children to Molek and do not put him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will set My face against that man and against his family; and I will cut them off from their people, both him and those who follow after him as whores after Molek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who turns to spirits through mediums and necromancers in order to whore after them, I will even set My face against that person and will cut him off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consecrate yourselves therefore, and be holy, for I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep My statutes, and do them; I am the Lord who sanctifies you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For anyone who curses his father or his mother shall be surely put to death. He has cursed his father or his mother, and his blood guilt shall be upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man commits adultery with another man’s wife, even he who commits adultery with his neighbor’s wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with his father’s wife, he has exposed his father’s nakedness. Both of them shall surely be put to death. Their blood guilt shall be upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall surely be put to death. They have committed a perversion. Their blood guilt shall be upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with another man as with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination. They shall surely be put to death. Their blood guilt shall be upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with a woman and also her mother, it is wickedness. Both he and they shall be burned with fire, so that there is no wickedness among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with an animal, he shall surely be put to death, and you shall kill the animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a woman approaches an animal and lies with it, you shall kill the woman and the animal. They shall surely be put to death. Their blood guilt shall be upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with his sister, whether the daughter of his father or mother, they have exposed each other’s nakedness; it is a wicked thing and they shall be cut off from the sight of their people. He has exposed his sister’s nakedness, and he shall bear his iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with a woman during her menstrual period and exposes her nakedness, her fountain of blood is then exposed. Both of them shall be cut off from among their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not have relations with your mother’s sister or your father’s sister, for this is to expose the nakedness of one’s relative. They shall bear their iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with his uncle’s wife, he has exposed his uncle’s nakedness. They shall bear their sin. They shall die childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man lies with his brother’s wife, it is impurity. He has exposed his brother’s nakedness. They shall be childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall therefore keep all My statutes and all My decrees and do them, so that the land to where I am bringing you will not vomit you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not walk in the customs of the nation that I am driving out before you, for they committed all these things, and therefore I abhorred them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have said to you: You shall inherit their land, and I will give it to you to possess it, a land that flows with milk and honey. I am the Lord your God, who has separated you from other peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall therefore make distinction between the clean animal from the unclean, and the unclean fowl from the clean, and you shall not make yourselves detestable by animal, or by fowl, or by any manner of living thing that crawls on the ground, which I have separated from you as unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall be holy unto Me; for I the Lord am holy and have separated you from other peoples, that you should be Mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man or woman who speaks to spirits as a medium or necromancer shall surely be put to death. They shall stone them. Their blood guilt shall be upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses: Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them: None shall make himself unclean for the dead among his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but for his closest relatives, that is, for his mother, his father, his son, his daughter, his brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his virgin sister (who is near him because she has not had a husband), for her he may be made unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall not make himself unclean as a husband among his people because of the dead and so defile himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not make bald areas on their heads, nor shall they shave off the edges of their beards, nor make any cuts in their flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be holy unto their God, and not profane the name of their God; for they offer the offerings of the Lord made by fire, and the food of their God. Therefore they shall be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not take a wife who is a whore or has been defiled, nor shall they take a woman divorced from her husband, for he is holy unto his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall sanctify him, for he offers the food of your God. He shall be holy to you, for I the Lord, who sanctifies you, am holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The daughter of any priest, if she defiles herself by being a whore, she also defiles her father. She shall be burned with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who is the high priest among his brothers, on whose head the anointing oil was poured and who is consecrated to wear the garments, shall not dishevel his hair, nor tear his clothes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor shall he approach any dead body, nor make himself unclean, even for his father or his mother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor shall he go out of the sanctuary, so as not to defile the sanctuary of his God, for the consecration of the anointing oil of his God is upon him: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall take a wife in her virginity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A widow, or a divorced woman, or a defiled woman, or a prostitute, these he shall not marry. But he shall take for a wife a virgin of his own people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that he does not defile his offspring among his people, for I am the Lord who sanctifies him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to Aaron, saying: None of your offspring in their generations who has any blemish may approach to offer the food of his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever has a blemish, he shall not approach, whether a blind or lame man, or one who has a physical flaw on his face or a limb that is too long,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or a man who has a broken foot or broken hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or a hunchback, or a dwarf, or who has a defect in his eye, or eczema or scabs, or is a eunuch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man who has a blemish from the offspring of Aaron the priest shall come near to offer the food offerings of the Lord made by fire. He has a blemish; he shall not come near to offer the bread of his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall eat the food of his God, both of the most holy and of the holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only he shall not go in through the veil or come to the altar, because he has a blemish, so that he does not defile My sanctuaries, for I am the Lord who sanctifies them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke this to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to Aaron and to his sons that they should be very respectful with the holy things of the children of Israel, and that they do not defile My holy name with those things which the people have consecrated to Me: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them: Whoever from your offspring through your generations approaches the holy things, which the children of Israel have dedicated to the Lord, while he has uncleanness, that person shall be cut off from My presence: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man of the offspring of Aaron is a leper or has a discharge, he shall not eat of the holy offerings until he is clean. And whoever touches anything that is unclean by contact with the dead or a man who had an emission of semen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or whoever touches any crawling thing whereby he may be made unclean, or a man from whom he may receive uncleanness, whatever uncleanness he has,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the person who has touched any such thing shall be unclean until evening, and shall not eat of the holy things unless he washes his body with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun goes down, he shall be clean, and afterward he shall eat of the holy things, because it is his food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which dies of itself or is torn by animals he shall not eat, becoming unclean by it: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall therefore keep My ordinance, lest they bear sin from it and therefore die if they defile it: I am the Lord who sanctifies them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be no outsider who eats of a holy thing, whether a foreign guest of the priest or a hired servant, he shall not eat of a holy offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a priest buys a person with his money, the person acquired shall eat of it, and he that is born in his house shall eat of his food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the priest’s daughter marries an outsider, she may not eat of an offering of the holy things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the priest’s daughter is a widow or divorced, and has no child and has returned to her father’s house as in her youth, she may eat of her father’s food; but no outsider may eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man eats the holy thing unwittingly, then he shall add a fifth of the value to it and shall give the holy thing to the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not defile the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and cause them to suffer and to bear the iniquity of guilt when they eat their holy things, for I am the Lord who sanctifies them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel, and say to them: Whoever from the house of Israel or from the foreigners in Israel who offers his burnt offering for any vows or freewill offerings that he offers to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then if it is to be accepted for you, the offering shall be a male without blemish, a bull, sheep, or goat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whatever has a blemish you shall not offer, for it shall not be acceptable for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever offers a sacrifice of peace offerings to the Lord to fulfill his vow or a freewill offering, whether from the herd or flock, to be accepted it shall be perfect, with no blemish on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blind, or disabled, or maimed, or having an ulcer or eczema or scabs, you shall not offer these to the Lord, nor make a food offering by fire on the altar to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A herd animal or a flock animal that has a limb that is too long or short you may offer for a freewill offering, but for a vow it shall not be accepted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not offer to the Lord an animal that is bruised or crushed or torn or cut; nor shall you make any offering of them in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor from a foreigner shall you offer an animal as the food of your God, because a blemish is in them from their mutilation. They shall not be accepted for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When an ox, or a sheep, or a goat is born, then it shall be seven days with its mother, and from the eighth day and thereafter it shall be accepted for a food offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall not slaughter on the same day an ox or a sheep and her young.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving to the Lord, offer it so that it may be accepted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the same day it shall be eaten. You shall leave none of it until the next day: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you shall keep My commandments and do them: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not defile My holy name, but I will be sanctified among the children of Israel: I am the Lord who sanctifies you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: Concerning the feasts of the Lord that you shall proclaim to be holy convocations, these are My appointed feasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For six days work shall be done, but the seventh day is the Sabbath of complete rest, a holy convocation. You shall do no work. It is the Sabbath of the Lord in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the appointed feasts of the Lord, holy convocations which you shall proclaim in their appointed times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourteenth day of the first month at evening is the Lord’s Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fifteenth day of the same month is the Feast of Unleavened Bread to the Lord. For seven days you must eat unleavened bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall offer a food offering made by fire to the Lord for seven days. On the seventh day is a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: When you have come into the land that I am giving to you and reap its harvest, then you shall bring a sheaf bundle of the first fruits of your harvest to the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall wave the sheaf before the Lord so that you may be accepted. On the day after the Sabbath the priest shall wave it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall offer that day when you wave the sheaf a year-old male lamb without blemish for a burnt offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grain offering shall be two-tenths of an ephah of wheat flour mixed with oil, a food offering made by fire to the Lord for a pleasing aroma; its drink offering shall be of wine, a fourth of a hin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat neither bread nor grain, parched or fresh, until the same day that you have brought an offering to your God. It shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall count seven full weeks from the next day after the Sabbath, from the day that you brought the sheaf bundle of the wave offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall count fifty days to the day after the seventh Sabbath; then you shall offer a new grain offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall bring out of your habitations two wave loaves of two-tenths of an ephah. They shall be of wheat flour, baked with leaven. They are the first fruits to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall offer with the bread seven lambs without blemish of the first year, one bull, and two rams. They shall be for a burnt offering to the Lord, with their grain offering and their drink offerings, that is, a food offering made by fire, of a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall sacrifice one male goat for a sin offering, and two lambs of the first year for a sacrifice of peace offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall wave them with the bread of the first fruits for a wave offering before the Lord with the two lambs. They shall be holy to the Lord for the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make a proclamation on the same day and shall hold a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work. It shall be a perpetual statute in all your dwellings throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap your field up to the edge, nor shall you gather any gleaning of your harvest. You shall leave them to the poor and to the foreigner: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to the children of Israel, saying: In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall have a sabbath, a memorial with the blowing of trumpets, a holy convocation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do no regular work, and you shall offer a food offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also on the tenth day of this seventh month there shall be the Day of Atonement. It shall be a holy convocation to you, and you shall humble yourselves, and offer a food offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do no work on that same day, for it is the Day of Atonement to make atonement for you before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever is not humbled on that same day, he shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever does any work in that same day, that person I will destroy from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do no manner of work. It shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be to you a sabbath of complete rest, and you shall afflict your souls. On the ninth day of the month starting at the evening, from evening to evening, you shall celebrate your sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to the children of Israel, saying: The fifteenth day of this seventh month shall be the Feast of Tabernacles for seven days to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day shall be a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven days you shall offer food offerings made by fire to the Lord. On the eighth day it shall be a holy convocation to you, and you shall offer a food offering made by fire to the Lord. It is a solemn assembly, and you shall do no regular work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the appointed feasts of the Lord, which you shall proclaim to be holy convocations, to offer a food offering made by fire to the Lord, burnt offerings and grain offerings, sacrifices and drink offerings, each on its proper day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: besides the Sabbaths of the Lord, besides your gifts, besides all your vows, and besides all your freewill offerings which you give to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the produce of the land, you shall keep a feast to the Lord for seven days. On the first day shall be a sabbath, and on the eighth day shall be a sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take on the first day the branches of majestic trees—branches of palm trees, branches of leafy trees, and willows from a brook, and you shall rejoice before the Lord your God for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep it as a feast to the Lord for seven days in the year. It shall be a perpetual statute in your generations. You shall celebrate it in the seventh month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall dwell in booths for seven days. All who are native children of Israel shall dwell in booths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that your generations may know that I made the children of Israel dwell in booths when I brought them out of the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses declared to the children of Israel the feasts of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command the children of Israel that they bring to you pure olive oil beaten for the lamp, to cause the lamps to burn continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Outside the veil of the sanctuary, in the tent of meeting, Aaron shall arrange it continually, from the evening until the morning before the Lord. It shall be a perpetual statute in your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall arrange the lamps continually on the pure gold lampstand before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take wheat flour and bake twelve cakes. Two-tenths of an ephah shall be in each cake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set them in two rows, six in a row, on the pure gold table before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put pure frankincense on each row, so that it may be on the bread for a memorial, a food offering made by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every Sabbath he shall set it in order continually before the Lord, with the portion taken from the children of Israel by a perpetual covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be for Aaron and his sons, and they shall eat it in a holy place, for it is most holy to him of the food offerings of the Lord made by fire by a perpetual statute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of an Israelite woman, whose father was an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel, and this son of the Israelite woman and a man of Israel fought together in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Israelite woman’s son blasphemed the name of the Lord and cursed. And they brought him to Moses. (His mother’s name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they put him in custody, so that the words of the Lord might be shown to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring outside the camp him who has cursed, and let all who heard him lay their hands on his head, and let the entire congregation stone him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall speak to the children of Israel, saying: Whoever curses his God shall bear his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever blasphemes the name of the Lord, he shall surely be put to death, and the entire congregation shall certainly stone him. The foreigner as well as the native in the land, when he blasphemes the name, then he shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever kills any man shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever kills an animal shall make restitution, animal for animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone causes injury to his neighbor, as he has done, so shall it be done to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth; as he has caused an injury to another, so shall it be done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever kills an animal shall make restitution. And whoever kills a man shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall have one manner of law for the foreigner as for the native, for I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses spoke to the children of Israel, and they brought outside the camp him who had cursed, and stoned him. And the children of Israel did as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: When you come into the land that I give you, the land shall keep a sabbath to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For six years you shall sow your field, and six years you shall prune your vineyard and gather in its fruit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in the seventh year there shall be a sabbath of complete rest for the land, a sabbath for the Lord. You shall neither sow your field nor prune your vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which grows by itself from your harvest you shall not reap, nor gather the grapes of your unpruned vines, for it is a year of complete rest for the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sabbath produce of the land shall be food for you: for you, and for your male and female servants, and for your hired servant, and for your stranger who sojourns with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for your livestock, and for the wild animals in your land, shall all its increase be food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall count seven sabbath weeks of years, seven times seven years, and the time of the seven sabbaths of years shall be to you forty-nine years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall sound the horn blasts on the tenth day of the seventh month. On the Day of Atonement you shall make the sound of the horn throughout all your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall consecrate the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout all the land to all the inhabitants. It shall be a Jubilee to you, and each of you shall return to his possession, and every person shall return to his family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That fiftieth year will be a Jubilee for you. You shall neither sow nor reap that which grows by itself, nor gather the grapes of your unpruned vines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is the Jubilee. It shall be holy to you. You shall eat the produce of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the Year of Jubilee you shall return to your property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you sell anything to your neighbor or buy anything from your neighbor, you shall not oppress one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the number of years after the Jubilee you shall pay your neighbor, and according to the number of years of the crops he shall sell to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the increase of years you shall increase the price, and according to the decrease of years you shall diminish the price of it. For he shall sell to you according to the number of years of crops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not therefore oppress one another, but you shall fear your God. For I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you shall do My statutes, and keep My decrees, and do them, and you shall dwell securely in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land shall yield its fruit, and you shall eat your fill and live securely in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you shall say, “What shall we eat in the seventh year, if we shall not sow nor gather in our crop?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will command My blessing upon you in the sixth year, and it shall bring forth produce for three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall sow in the eighth year, and eat yet of old crops until the ninth year until its crops come in for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The land shall not be permanently sold, for the land is Mine. For you are foreigners and sojourners with Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all the land of your possession you shall grant a redemption for the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your brother becomes poor and has sold some of his possession, then his nearest redeemer will come to redeem it, and buy back that which his brother sold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the man has none to redeem it, but he himself is able to redeem it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then let him count the years since the sale and pay back the balance to the man to whom he sold it, so that he may return to his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he is not able to restore it to himself, then that which he sold shall remain in the hand of him who has bought it until the Year of Jubilee, and in the Jubilee it shall be released, and he shall return to his possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man sells a house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a year after it is sold, within a full year he may have the right to buy it back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is not redeemed within the time of a full year, then the house that is in the walled city shall be given permanently to him who bought it throughout his generations. It shall not be returned in the Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the houses of the villages that have no wall around them shall be counted as the fields of the land. They may be redeemed, and they shall be returned in the Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the cities of the Levites, they may redeem at any time the houses in the cities that they possess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a Levite purchases back the house that was sold in the city of his possession, then it shall be returned in the Jubilee. For the houses of the cities of the Levites are their possession among the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the fields of the land of their cities may not be sold, for they are their perpetual possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your brother becomes poor and cannot maintain himself with you, then you shall support him as if he were a foreigner or a sojourner, so that he may live with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take no usury or interest from him; but fear your God, so that your brother may live with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not lend him your money at interest, nor lend him your food for profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan and to be your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your brother who dwells near you becomes poor and sells himself to you, you shall not compel him to serve as a bondservant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as a hired servant and as a sojourner he shall be with you. He shall serve you until the Year of Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then he shall depart from you, both he and his children with him, and he shall return to his own family and to the possession of his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they are My servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt. They shall not be sold as slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not rule over him with harshness, but you shall fear your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both your male and female slaves, whom you may have, they shall be bought from the nations that are around you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover of the foreigners who sojourn among you and of their families who are with you, who were born in your land, you may also buy from them, and they may be your possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may take them as an inheritance for your children after you, for their possession. They shall be your slaves forever. But over your brothers, the children of Israel, you shall not rule over one another with rigor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a sojourner or foreigner becomes rich by you, and your brother who dwells beside him becomes poor and sells himself to the foreigner or sojourner with you, or to a member of the stranger’s family,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then after he is sold he may be redeemed again. One of his brothers may redeem him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or either his uncle or his cousin may redeem him, or any who is near of kin to him of his family may redeem him. Or if he is able, he may redeem himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall calculate with him who bought him from the year that he was sold to the Year of Jubilee, and the price of his sale shall be according to the number of years, according to the time of a hired servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there are still many years left until the Jubilee, he shall pay the price proportionately for his redemption as some of the price that he was bought for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there remain but a few years until the Year of Jubilee, then he shall calculate and pay the price proportionately for his redemption according to his years of service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a yearly hired servant he shall be treated, and the other shall not rule harshly over him in your sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he is not redeemed in these years, then he shall go out in the Year of Jubilee, both he and his children with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to Me the children of Israel are servants. They are My servants whom I brought out of the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not make for yourselves idols; neither set up a carved image nor a standing stone, nor shall you set up any sculpted stone in your land to bow down to it, for I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep My Sabbaths and reverence My sanctuary: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you walk in My statutes and keep My commandments and do them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will give you rain in due season, and the land shall yield its increase, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your threshing shall last till the grape harvest, and the grape harvest shall last till the time for sowing, and you shall eat your bread till you are full and dwell in your land safely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give peace in the land, and you shall lie down for sleep, and none shall make you afraid; I will remove harmful beasts from the land, and the sword shall not go through your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall chase your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five of you shall chase a hundred, and a hundred of you shall put ten thousand to flight, and your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will turn toward you and make you fruitful and multiply you, and I will confirm My covenant with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat the old harvest long stored, and clear out the old to make way for the new.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set My tabernacle among you, and I shall not abhor you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will walk among you, and I will be your God, and you shall be My people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, that you should not be their slaves, and I have broken the bars of your yoke and made you walk upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not listen to Me, and will not do all these commandments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you despise My statutes, or if you abhor My judgments, so that you will not do all My commandments, but you break My covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will do this to you: I will visit you with terror, with wasting disease, and with a fever that shall consume the eyes and cause sorrow of heart, and you shall sow your seed in vain, for your enemies shall eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set My face against you, and you shall be slain before your enemies. They that hate you shall reign over you, and you shall flee when none pursues you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you will not yet listen to Me after all this, then I will punish you seven times more for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will break the pride of your power, and I will make your heaven as iron and your land as bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your strength shall be spent in vain, for your land shall not yield her increase, nor shall the trees of the land yield their fruits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you continue to walk contrary to Me and will not listen to Me, I will bring seven times more plagues upon you according to your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also send wild beasts among you, which shall rob you of your children, destroy your livestock, and make you few in number. And your roads shall be desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if by these things you are not turned to Me, but walk contrary to Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will also walk contrary to you and will punish you yet seven times for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring a sword upon you that shall extract vengeance for My covenant. And when you are gathered together within your cities, I will send pestilence among you, and you shall be delivered into the hand of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I have broken the supply of your bread, ten women shall bake your bread in one oven, and they shall ration your bread again by weight, and you shall eat and not be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you will not listen to Me for all this, but walk contrary to Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will walk contrary to you also in fury, and I Myself will chastise you seven times for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat the flesh of your sons and the flesh of your daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will destroy your high places, and cut down your images, and cast your funeral offerings on the lifeless forms of your idols, and I shall abhor you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make your cities a waste and bring your sanctuaries to desolation, and I will not smell the savor of your fragrant offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring the land into desolation, and your enemies that dwell there shall be astonished at it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter you among the nations and I will draw out a sword after you. And your land shall be desolate and your cities a waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the land shall enjoy its sabbaths as long as it lies desolate, while you are in your enemies’ land; then the land shall rest and enjoy its sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as it lies desolate it shall rest because it did not rest during your sabbaths when you lived upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on those who are left alive of you I will send faintness into their hearts in the lands of their enemies; and the sound of a shaken leaf shall make them flee, and they shall flee as from a sword, and they shall fall when no one pursues.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall fall one upon one another, as to escape before the sword, though no one pursues, and you shall have no power to stand before your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall perish among the nations, and the land of your enemies shall consume you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who are left of you shall rot away in their iniquity in your enemies’ lands, and also because of the iniquities of their fathers, they shall rot away with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they confess their iniquity, and the iniquity of their fathers, with their treachery that they committed against Me, and also that they have walked contrary to Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that I also have walked contrary to them and have brought them into the land of their enemies; if then their uncircumcised hearts are humbled, and they then accept the punishment of their iniquity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then will I remember My covenant with Jacob, and also My covenant with Isaac, and also My covenant with Abraham, and I will remember the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the land shall be abandoned by them, and enjoy its sabbaths while it lies desolate without them. They shall make amends for their iniquity, because they despised My judgments and because they abhorred My statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet for all that, when they are in the land of their enemies, I will not cast them away, nor will I abhor them to destroy them utterly and to break My covenant with them, for I am the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But for their sake I will remember the covenant with their fathers, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt in the sight of the nations, that I might be their God: I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the statutes and judgments and laws that the Lord made between Himself and the children of Israel on Mount Sinai by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: When a man makes a special vow to the Lord based on the equivalent value of persons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the equivalent value of a male from twenty to sixty years old shall be fifty shekels of silver, according to the sanctuary shekel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the person is a female, then the equivalent value shall be thirty shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the person is five to twenty years old, then the equivalent value shall be twenty shekels for a male and ten shekels for a female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the person is one month to five years old, then the equivalent value shall be five shekels for a male and three shekels of silver for a female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the person is sixty years old or older, then the equivalent value shall be fifteen shekels for a male and ten shekels for a female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he is too poor to afford the equivalent value, then he shall present himself before the priest and the priest shall set his value. According to what the person making the vow can afford, so the priest shall set his value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it be an animal, of which men bring an offering to the Lord, all that any man gives of such to the Lord shall be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not exchange it nor substitute it, good for bad or bad for good. If he in fact substitutes an animal for another, then both it and its substitute shall be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is any sort of unclean animal that is not permitted as an offering to the Lord, then he shall present the animal before the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall set its value, whether good or bad; according to the equivalent value set by the priest, so shall it be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he plans on redeeming it, then he shall add one-fifth to the equivalent value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man consecrates his house as holy to the Lord, then the priest shall set its value, whether good or bad, according to the equivalent value set by the priest, so shall it be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he who consecrates the house should redeem it, then he shall add one-fifth to its equivalent value, and it shall be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man shall consecrate to the Lord some of his land, then the equivalent value shall be according to the seed needed to sow it: fifty shekels of silver per homer of barley seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he consecrates his field from the Year of Jubilee, the equivalent value shall stay fixed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if he consecrates his field after the Jubilee, then the priest shall calculate for him the price according to the years that remain until the next Year of Jubilee, and the equivalent value shall be reduced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he who consecrated the field plans on redeeming it, then he shall add one-fifth to the equivalent value, and it will be established as his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he does not redeem the field, but rather sells the field to another man, it may not be redeemed again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the field is released in the Jubilee, it shall be holy to the Lord as a devoted field; it shall become the possession of the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man consecrates to the Lord a field that he purchased, which is not part of his land property,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the priest shall calculate for him the amount of the valuation, up to the Year of Jubilee, and he shall give your valuation on that day as a holy thing to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the Year of Jubilee the field shall return to the one from whom it was bought, to him to whom the property of land belongs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All your estimations shall be according to the shekel of the sanctuary: Twenty gerahs shall be one shekel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A firstborn of animals, which as firstborn belongs to the Lord, no man may consecrate; whether ox or sheep, it is the Lord’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is among the unclean animals, then he shall ransom it at the equivalent value and shall add one-fifth to it, but if it is not redeemed, then it shall be sold at the equivalent value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anything that a man shall devote to the Lord from all that he has, whether human, animal, or land, shall not be sold or redeemed. Every devoted thing is most holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one devoted of men, who shall be doomed to death, shall be redeemed; he shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any tithe of the land, whether seed of the land or fruit of the trees, belongs to the Lord. It is holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man plans on redeeming some of his tithe, he shall add one-fifth to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any tithe of herd or flock, all that passes under the counting staff, the tenth one shall be holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A person shall not differentiate between good or bad, nor shall he make a substitute for it, but if he does, then both it and its substitute shall be holy. It shall not be redeemed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the commandments that the Lord commanded Moses for the children of Israel on Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator
